name: Classic Spaghetti Bolognese
description: A rich and hearty Italian meat sauce, perfect with spaghetti.
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large pan. Add onion and cook until softened.
Add ground beef and cook until browned, breaking it up with a spoon.
Drain excess fat. Stir in garlic, cook for 1 minute.
Pour in red wine, bring to a simmer and cook until reduced by half.
Stir in chopped tomatoes and stock cube. Season with salt and pepper.
Bring to a gentle simmer, then reduce heat, cover, and cook for at least 30 minutes (or longer for richer flavor), stirring occasionally.
Serve hot with cooked spaghetti.

name: Vegetable Stir-fry
description: Quick and healthy stir-fry with your favorite vegetables.
instructions: In a small bowl, whisk together soy sauce, sesame oil, ginger, and garlic.
Heat a large wok or pan over high heat. Add a little oil.
Add tofu (if using) and cook until golden, then remove.
Add harder vegetables (broccoli, carrots) and stir-fry for 3-4 minutes.
Add softer vegetables (bell pepper, snow peas) and stir-fry for another 2-3 minutes.
Return tofu to the pan. Pour in the sauce and toss to coat.
Cook for 1-2 minutes until sauce thickens slightly. Serve immediately with rice or noodles.

name: Chicken Caesar Salad
description: A classic Caesar salad with grilled chicken breast.
instructions: Season chicken breasts with salt and pepper. Grill or pan-fry until cooked through.
Let chicken rest, then slice into strips.
Wash and chop romaine lettuce. Place in a large bowl.
Add croutons, Parmesan cheese, and sliced chicken.
Drizzle with Caesar dressing and toss gently to combine.
Serve immediately.

name: Creamy Tomato Pasta
description: A simple yet delicious pasta dish with a rich, creamy tomato sauce.
instructions: Cook pasta according to package directions until al dente. Drain and set aside.
While pasta cooks, heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add onion and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
Add garlic and cook for 1 minute until fragrant.
Stir in crushed tomatoes, salt, and pepper. Bring to a simmer and cook for 10-15 minutes, allowing sauce to thicken.
Reduce heat to low, stir in heavy cream and Parmesan cheese until well combined and heated through.
Add cooked pasta to the sauce and toss to coat. Stir in fresh basil.
Serve immediately, garnished with extra Parmesan if desired.

name: Lemon Herb Roasted Chicken
description: Tender and juicy roasted chicken infused with lemon and aromatic herbs.
instructions: Preheat oven to 200°C (400°F).
Pat chicken dry with paper towels. Season generously inside and out with salt and pepper.
Stuff the chicken cavity with lemon quarters, rosemary, thyme, and smashed garlic.
Place chicken in a roasting pan. Drizzle with olive oil and rub evenly over the skin.
Arrange onion quarters around the chicken in the pan (if using).
Roast for 1 hour to 1 hour 20 minutes, or until internal temperature reaches 74°C (165°F) and juices run clear.
Let rest for 10-15 minutes before carving and serving.

name: Quick Black Bean Burgers
description: Flavorful vegetarian burgers made with black beans, perfect for a quick meal.
ingredients: 1 can (400g) black beans, rinsed and drained
instructions: In a large bowl, mash black beans with a fork until mostly smooth but still chunky.
Stir in breadcrumbs, onion, garlic, cumin, chili powder, salt, and pepper until well combined.
Form the mixture into 2-3 patties.
Heat olive oil in a non-stick skillet over medium heat.
Cook patties for 4-5 minutes per side, or until golden brown and heated through.
Serve hot on burger buns with your favorite toppings.

name: Simple Overnight Oats
description: An easy, healthy, and customizable breakfast that prepares itself overnight.
ingredients: Toppings: fresh berries, nuts, shredded coconut
instructions: In a jar or container, combine oats, milk, chia seeds, maple syrup/honey, and vanilla extract.
Stir well to combine, ensuring no clumps of oats or chia seeds remain.
Cover the jar and refrigerate overnight (or for at least 4 hours).
In the morning, stir well. If too thick, add a splash more milk.
Top with your favorite fruits, nuts, or other additions and serve cold.

name: Sheet Pan Lemon Herb Salmon & Asparagus
description: A flavorful and easy one-pan meal, perfect for a healthy weeknight dinner.
instructions: Preheat oven to 200°C (400°F). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Place salmon fillets on one side of the baking sheet. Arrange asparagus on the other side.
Drizzle everything with olive oil. Season salmon and asparagus generously with salt, pepper, and dried dill.
Place lemon slices over the salmon and asparagus.
Roast for 12-18 minutes, or until salmon is cooked through and flakes easily with a fork, and asparagus is tender-crisp.
Serve immediately.
